name: Hidden Falls (Wasatch Front)
description:
Hidden falls is a pretty waterfall located in Big Cottonwood Canyon. It is a short walk from the road and can be rappelled for a fun short canyoneering trip that can be done in under an hour. It is an easy trip but during high spring flows it may require wetsuits and swift water skills.

Approach

Hike up the mill B north Fork trail till it is above the falls and follow a social trail down to the creek.

Descent

Walk down the creek till you reach the top of the falls. Anchor from a tree DCR and rappel approximately 60ft

Exit

Hike out 5 min to the road. There is an old mine that can be explored on the way out.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
